Description:
We seek a dynamic and experienced Human Resources Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker, well-versed in HR best practices, and knowledgeable about Saudi labor laws and regulations. In addition to HR expertise, the candidate should excel in administrative and government relations management.Key Responsibilities:HR Strategy: Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with company objectives. Ensure HR policies and practices comply with Saudi labor laws.
Talent Acquisition: Oversee recruitment efforts, including sourcing, interviewing, and onboarding. Collaborate with department heads to identify staffing needs.
Employee Relations: Foster a positive workplace culture. Handle employee grievances, disputes, and disciplinary matters professionally and impartially.
Performance Management: Implement performance appraisal systems and strategies to enhance employee productivity and growth.
Training and Development: Identify training needs, plan and execute training programs to enhance employee skills and competencies.
Compensation and Benefits: Manage compensation and benefits programs. Ensure competitiveness and compliance with industry standards.
Government Relations: Develop and maintain strong relationships with government agencies and authorities. Stay updated on industry norms, regulations, and labor laws.
Administrative Management: Oversee administrative functions, including facilities, office management, and vendor relationships.
Creative Problem-Solving: Approach HR and administrative challenges with a creative and solutions-oriented mindset.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field (Master's degree preferred).
Proven experience as an HR Manager with a minimum of 5 years in Saudi Arabia.
Strong knowledge of Saudi labor laws, regulations, and industry norms.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
A positive and proactive approach to HR and administrative challenges.
Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills.
Strong leadership and team management capabilities.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and act with integrity.
Fluency in English is a mandatory requirement and proficiency in Arabic is a strong preference.

TriStar Technical Co. is the pioneering and exclusive producer of PolyCarboxylate Ether (PCE), an advanced superplasticizer in concrete technology, in Saudi Arabia. As industry leaders, we are committed to innovation, quality, and sustainable business practices.
